class="heading Heading_root__KdmZo weight-regular title clamp-lines Metadata_title__aM3nZ">BlueHat v17 || 10 Years of Targeted Credential Phishing | Billy Leonard </h1><button type="button" class="ai-tag unstyled-button AITag_aiTag__A72IV" data-cy="ai-tag" aria-describedby="aiTag-description" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1h9rm:" popovertarget=":R1h9rm:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1h9rm"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:16px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG"><span class="Icon_mask__bniyY" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/sparkles.767ac5cb.svg)"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></span>AI-enhanced description</button><div class="" id=":R1h9rm:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1h9rm"></div><div class="description Description_root__kt4uq Description_clamped__PaV_1"><div class="Description_wrapper__hYE9_"><p data-cy="document-description">The document presents a comprehensive analysis of targeted credential phishing threats over the past decade, detailing the evolution of attack methods and defenses. It highlights crucial developments like SMS interception, two-factor authentication vulnerabilities, and the importance of security keys and OAuth. The report outlines various actors involved in these attacks and suggests enhanced protective measures to combat ongoing threats.</p><div><div class="CategoryLinks_root__f1kT8"><a class="link Old habits die hard.

It began by exploiting a vulnerability in Microsoft SMBv1 protocol using NSA hacking tools leaked online. Insider attacks account for 30-50% of cybersecurity incidents according to various studies. Insider threats can be malicious, negligent, or accidental. They are challenging to detect and prevent because insiders have legitimate access that makes their harmful actions difficult to distinguish from regular job functions.
